explosives.rationale: Containing no chemical groups with explosive properties

flammable_gases.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

oxidizing_gases.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

gases_under_pressure.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

flammable_liquids.rationale: The flash point is 181degC (open cup flash test) (ICSC, 2001)

flammable_solids.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

self_reactive_substances.rationale: Containing no chemical groups with explosive or self-reactive properties

pyrophoric_liquids.rationale: Not pyrophoric when in contact with air at ordinary temperatures: the auto-ignition temperature is 395degC (ICSC, 2001)

pyrophoric_solids.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

self_heating_substances.rationale: Test methods applicable to liquid substances are not available

substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.hazard_name: Substances and mixtures, which in contact with water, emit flammable gases
substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.rationale: Containing no metals or metalloids (B, Si, P, Ge, As, Se, Sn, Sb, Te, Bi, Po, At)

oxidizing_liquids.rationale: Organic compounds containing oxygen (but not fluorine and chlorine), with the oxygen bound to carbon and hydrogen (but not to other elements)

oxidizing_solids.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

acute_toxicity_oral.rationale: Based on the rat LD50 (oral route) value of 9,100mg/kg representing the lower of the two testing data, 9,100mg/kg (MOE Risk Assessment vol. 2, 2003) and 25,000mg/kg (IARC 77 (2000)).

acute_toxicity_dermal.rationale: Based on the rabbit LD50 (dermal route) of 14,752mg/kg (MOE Risk Assessment vol. 2 (2003)).

acute_toxicity_inhalation_gas.rationale: Due to the fact that the substance is "liquid" according to the GHS definition and inhalation of its gas is not expected.

skin_corrosion_irritation.rationale: Based on the description in CERI Hazard Data 97-12 (1998) (Rabbit primary skin irritation tests indicate slight erythema, which disappears after 72 hours of exposure: Category 3) and MOE Risk Assessment vol. 2 (2003) (Animal studies indicate no skin irritation: Not Classified). Classified as "Category 3" from the viewpoint of safety.

serious_eye_damage_irritation.rationale: Based on the text in MOE Risk Assessment vol. 2 (2003): Animal studies indicate no skin/eye irritation. However, classification is not possible because of the lack of data serving as a basis for "Not Classified."

respiratory_skin_sensitizer.classification: Respiratory sensitizer: Classification not possible Skin sensitizer: Classification not possible
respiratory_skin_sensitizer.rationale: Respiratory sensitizer: No data available Skin sensitizer: Guinea pig skin sensitization tests (CERI Hazard Data 97-12 (1998), MOE Risk Assessment vol. 2 (2003)) indicate no skin sensitization. However, classification is not possible because of a limited number of test results (with details of which unknown) and the absence of epidemiological findings.

germ_cell_mutagenicity.rationale: Based on the slight positive data on germ cell multi-generation tests in vivo (dominant lethal tests). However, the dosage is 9,220mg/kg (which exceeds the upper limit of the current guidelines) and the results are based on intraperitoneal administration; the biological significance of slight responsiveness, if any, should be negligible, and hence should be considered "negative." Also based on the absence of data on germ cell mutagenicity tests in vivo, and the negative data on somatic mutagenicity tests in vivo, described in IARC 29 (1982) and IARC 77 (2000).

carcinogenicity.rationale: Due to the fact that the substance is classified as Category 3 by IARC 77 (2000) and Group C by EPA (1994).

toxic_to_reproduction.rationale: Based on the description in MOE Risk Assessment vol. 2 (2003) and IARC 77 (2000): rat one-generation test suggested body weight/length reduction of the embryo at dosing levels toxic to parental animals; rat teratogenicity tests in suggest dose-dependent ureteral malformations (expansion and convolution) in the embryo, with no description of the general toxicity to parental animals.

systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organs/systemic toxicity following single exposure

systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organs/systemic toxicity following repeated exposure

acute_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: Since acute toxicity is not reported within the aqueous solubility concentrations (0.0032mg/L (SIDS (2002))), it was classified into Not classified.

chronic_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: Since there was rapidly degrading (the decomposition by BOD: 71% (Existing Chemical Safety Inspections Data)) and the bio-accumulation was low (BCF=27 (CERI/NITE Hazard Assessment Report (preliminary version), 2006)), it was claasified into Not classified.
